newsitem.title: USA: Delphi Information names Aetna exec as CEO.
newsitem.headline: Delphi Information names Aetna exec as CEO.

text.p: Delphi Information Systems Inc on Thursday named John Trustman, formerly chief information officer of Aetna Inc, as president and chief executive.
Last August, Delphi, which develops and markets software for the insurance industry, announced Denis Connaghan resigned as president and chief executive for personal reasons.

"We are extremely pleased to attract someone of John's caliber to Delphi," said Yuval Almog, chairman of the board of directors in a statement. "John's background of leadership positions in information technology, consulting and the insurance industry is unique and provides the necessary insights to continue Delphi's transition toward being the leading provider of high-quality solutions to insurance industry participants' data management needs. We are confident that John will provide the hands-on leadership required for us to continue our path toward creating the 'New Delphi'."
Trustman, in a statement, said Delphi was poised to take advantage of consolidation and a changing distribution structure trend in the insurance industry.

Delphi said Trustman was responsible for restructuring and leading Aetna's transformation from a product-focused company to a customer-focused organization using technical solutions that created an interactive, recurring linkage between Aetna and its customers.
